oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Diary of Floyd Johnson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Thiis is a selection of diary entries of Pvt. Floyd Wellington Johnson, Btry. E, 115th FA, 30th Div. Pvt. Wellington began his diary May 19, 1918 and continued to make entries until September 27, 1918. The 30th Division was composed of National Guard units from Tennessee, North Carolina, and South Carolina and were nicknamed the Old Hickory Division in honor of Andrew Jackson. The division served under British command for much of their time in Europe.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
